title: AbstractControl
contents:
mode_edit code
API / @angular/forms

AbstractControllink

This is the base class for FormControl, FormGroup, and FormArray.

abstract class AbstractControl { constructor(validator: ValidatorFn | null, asyncValidator: AsyncValidatorFn | null) get value: any validator: ValidatorFn | null asyncValidator: AsyncValidatorFn | null get parent: FormGroup | FormArray get status: string get valid: boolean get invalid: boolean get pending: boolean get disabled: boolean get enabled: boolean get errors: ValidationErrors | null get pristine: boolean get dirty: boolean get touched: boolean get untouched: boolean get valueChanges: Observable<any> get statusChanges: Observable<any> get updateOn: FormHooks get root: AbstractControl setValidators(newValidator: ValidatorFn | ValidatorFn[] | null): void setAsyncValidators(newValidator: AsyncValidatorFn | AsyncValidatorFn[] | null): void clearValidators(): void clearAsyncValidators(): void markAsTouched(opts: {...}): void markAsUntouched(opts: {...}): void markAsDirty(opts: {...}): void markAsPristine(opts: {...}): void markAsPending(opts: {...}): void disable(opts: {...}): void enable(opts: {...}): void setParent(parent: FormGroup | FormArray): void abstract setValue(value: any, options?: Object): void abstract patchValue(value: any, options?: Object): void abstract reset(value?: any, options?: Object): void updateValueAndValidity(opts: {...}): void setErrors(errors: ValidationErrors | null, opts: {...}): void get(path: Array<string | number> | string): AbstractControl | null getError(errorCode: string, path?: string[]): any hasError(errorCode: string, path?: string[]): boolean }

Subclasseslink

  • FormArray
  • FormControl
  • FormGroup

See Alsolink

  • Forms Guide

  • Reactive Forms Guide

  • Dynamic Forms Guide

Descriptionlink

It provides some of the shared behavior that all controls and groups of controls have, like running validators, calculating status, and resetting state. It also defines the properties that are shared between all sub-classes, like value, valid, and dirty. It shouldn't be instantiated directly.

Constructorlink

Initialize the AbstractControl instance.
constructor(validator: ValidatorFn | null, asyncValidator: AsyncValidatorFn | null)

Parameters

validator

The function that will determine the synchronous validity of this control.
asyncValidator

The function that will determine the asynchronous validity of this control.

Propertieslink

PropertyTypeDescription
value Read-only.
validator

The function that will determine the synchronous validity of this control.

Declared in constructor.
asyncValidator

The function that will determine the asynchronous validity of this control.

Declared in constructor.
parent Read-only.

The parent control.
status Read-only.

The validation status of the control. There are four possible validation statuses:

  • VALID: control has passed all validation checks
  • INVALID: control has failed at least one validation check
  • PENDING: control is in the midst of conducting a validation check
  • DISABLED: control is exempt from validation checks

These statuses are mutually exclusive, so a control cannot be both valid AND invalid or invalid AND disabled.
valid Read-only.

A control is valid when its status === VALID.

In order to have this status, the control must have passed all its validation checks.
invalid Read-only.

A control is invalid when its status === INVALID.

In order to have this status, the control must have failed at least one of its validation checks.
pending Read-only.

A control is pending when its status === PENDING.

In order to have this status, the control must be in the middle of conducting a validation check.
disabled Read-only.

A control is disabled when its status === DISABLED.

Disabled controls are exempt from validation checks and are not included in the aggregate value of their ancestor controls.
enabled Read-only.

A control is enabled as long as its status !== DISABLED.

In other words, it has a status of VALID, INVALID, or PENDING.
errors Read-only.

Returns any errors generated by failing validation. If there are no errors, it will return null.
pristine Read-only.

A control is pristine if the user has not yet changed the value in the UI.

Note that programmatic changes to a control's value will not mark it dirty.
dirty Read-only.

A control is dirty if the user has changed the value in the UI.

Note that programmatic changes to a control's value will not mark it dirty.
touched Read-only.

A control is marked touched once the user has triggered a blur event on it.
untouched Read-only.

A control is untouched if the user has not yet triggered a blur event on it.
valueChanges Read-only.

Emits an event every time the value of the control changes, in the UI or programmatically.
statusChanges Read-only.

Emits an event every time the validation status of the control is re-calculated.
updateOn Read-only.

Returns the update strategy of the AbstractControl (i.e. the event on which the control will update itself). Possible values: 'change' (default) | 'blur' | 'submit'
root Read-only.

Retrieves the top-level ancestor of this control.

setValidators() link

Sets the synchronous validators that are active on this control. Calling this will overwrite any existing sync validators.

void

markAsTouched() link

Marks the control as touched.
markAsTouched(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

This will also mark all direct ancestors as touched to maintain the model.

markAsUntouched() link

Marks the control as untouched.
markAsUntouched(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

If the control has any children, it will also mark all children as untouched to maintain the model, and re-calculate the touched status of all parent controls.

markAsDirty() link

Marks the control as dirty.
markAsDirty(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

This will also mark all direct ancestors as dirty to maintain the model.

markAsPristine() link

Marks the control as pristine.
markAsPristine(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

If the control has any children, it will also mark all children as pristine to maintain the model, and re-calculate the pristine status of all parent controls.

markAsPending() link

Marks the control as pending.
markAsPending(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

An event will be emitted by statusChanges by default.

Passing false for emitEvent will cause statusChanges to not event an event.

disable() link

Disables the control. This means the control will be exempt from validation checks and excluded from the aggregate value of any parent. Its status is DISABLED.
disable(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

If the control has children, all children will be disabled to maintain the model.

enable() link

Enables the control. This means the control will be included in validation checks and the aggregate value of its parent. Its status is re-calculated based on its value and its validators.
enable(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

If the control has children, all children will be enabled.

updateValueAndValidity() link

Re-calculates the value and validation status of the control.
updateValueAndValidity(opts: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

opts

Type: { onlySelf?: boolean; emitEvent?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

By default, it will also update the value and validity of its ancestors.

setErrors() link

Sets errors on a form control.
setErrors(errors: ValidationErrors | null, opts: { emitEvent?: boolean; } = {}): void

Parameters

errors

Type: ValidationErrors | null.
opts

Type: { emitEvent?: boolean; }.

Optional. Default is {}.

Returns

void

This is used when validations are run manually by the user, rather than automatically.

Calling setErrors will also update the validity of the parent control.

Examplelink

const login = new FormControl("someLogin"); login.setErrors({ "notUnique": true }); expect(login.valid).toEqual(false); expect(login.errors).toEqual({"notUnique": true}); login.setValue("someOtherLogin"); expect(login.valid).toEqual(true);

get() link

Retrieves a child control given the control's name or path.
get(path: Array<string | number> | string): AbstractControl | null

Parameters

path

Type: Array | string.

Returns

AbstractControl | null

Paths can be passed in as an array or a string delimited by a dot.

To get a control nested within a person sub-group:

  • this.form.get('person.name');

-OR-

  • this.form.get(['person', 'name']);

getError() link

Returns error data if the control with the given path has the error specified. Otherwise returns null or undefined.
getError(errorCode: string, path?: string[]): any

Parameters

errorCode

Type: string.
path

Type: string[].

Optional. Default is undefined.

Returns

any

If no path is given, it checks for the error on the present control.

hasError() link

Returns true if the control with the given path has the error specified. Otherwise returns false.
hasError(errorCode: string, path?: string[]): boolean

Parameters

errorCode

Type: string.
path

Type: string[].

Optional. Default is undefined.

Returns

boolean

If no path is given, it checks for the error on the present control.
